verses.kjv: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
verses.web: Where has your beloved gone, you fairest among women? Where has your beloved turned, that we may seek him with you?
verses.ct: "Where has your beloved gone, most beautiful of women? Which way did he turn? We'll help you look for him."

verses.kjv: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
verses.web: My beloved has gone down to his garden, to the beds of spices, to pasture his flock in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
verses.ct: "My beloved has gone down to his garden, to the beds of spices, to enjoy the gardens and gather lilies."

verses.kjv: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.
verses.web: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine. He browses among the lilies.
verses.ct: "I belong to my beloved, and my beloved belongs to me — he who feeds among the lilies."

verses.kjv: Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.
verses.web: You are beautiful, my love, as Tirzah, lovely as Jerusalem, awesome as an army with banners.
verses.ct: "You are as beautiful as Tirzah, my love, as lovely as Jerusalem, as awe-inspiring as an army marching under its banners."

verses.kjv: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
verses.web: Turn away your eyes from me, for they have overcome me. Your hair is like a flock of goats, that lie along the side of Gilead.
verses.ct: "Look away from me — your eyes have overwhelmed me! Your hair flows like a flock of goats streaming down from Gilead."

verses.kjv: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.
verses.web: Your teeth are like a flock of ewes, which have come up from the washing, of which every one has twins; not one is bereaved among them.
verses.ct: "Your teeth are like a flock of freshly washed ewes, each one paired with its twin, not a single one missing."

verses.kjv: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.
verses.web: Your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate behind your veil.
verses.ct: "Behind your veil, your cheeks glow like the halves of a pomegranate."

verses.kjv: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
verses.web: There are sixty queens, eighty concubines, and virgins without number.
verses.ct: "There may be 60 queens and 80 concubines and young women beyond counting,"

verses.kjv: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
verses.web: My dove, my perfect one, is unique. She is her mother’s only daughter. She is the favorite one of her who bore her. The daughters saw her, and called her blessed. The queens and the concubines saw her, and they praised her.
verses.ct: "but my dove, my flawless one, stands alone. She is her mother's only daughter, the favorite of the woman who bore her. Every young woman who sees her calls her blessed; queens and concubines alike sing her praises."

verses.kjv: Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?
verses.web: Who is she who looks out as the morning, beautiful as the moon, clear as the sun, and awesome as an army with banners?
verses.ct: "Who is this that appears like the dawn, as beautiful as the moon, as radiant as the sun, as awe-inspiring as an army marching under its banners?"

verses.kjv: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.
verses.web: I went down into the nut tree grove, to see the green plants of the valley, to see whether the vine budded, and the pomegranates were in flower.
verses.ct: "I went down to the grove of nut trees to see the new growth in the valley, to check whether the vines had budded and the pomegranates had bloomed."

verses.kjv: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
verses.web: Without realizing it, my desire set me with my royal people’s chariots.
verses.ct: "Before I even realized it, my soul swept me away like the chariots of Amminadib."

verses.kjv: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
verses.web: Return, return, Shulammite! Return, return, that we may gaze at you. Why do you desire to gaze at the Shulammite, as at the dance of Mahanaim?
verses.ct: "Come back, come back, O Shulamite! Come back, come back so we can gaze at you! Why would you gaze at the Shulamite as though watching the dance of Mahanaim?"
